items.title: Multi-page Profile Card
items.description: A semantic profile site optimized for Lighthouse and automated tests.
bullets: Split the narrative into 3 themed pages connected with skip links and persistent breadcrumbs.
Shipped axe-clean markup and 98+ Lighthouse scores by auditing contrast, focus order, and aria usage.
Playwright smoke tests ensure responsive layouts hold up down to 320px devices.

items.title: myTickets Manager
items.description: A CRUD app implemented in three frameworks with shared design tokens.
bullets: Abstracted table/form/toast primitives so React, Vue, and Twig share the same UI contract.
Backed every mutation with JSON Schema validation + Faker fixtures to mimic a live ticket API.
Audited performance budgets to keep each build under 80 KB gzipped.

items.title: Audiophile E-commerce (Next.js + Convex)
items.description: A pixel-perfect storefront with a full checkout flow, order persistence, and transactional email, following an atomic design component system.
bullets: Typed API routes with Zod validation and Redux-based cart.
Atomic components and layout templates tuned for performance.

items.title: Todo App (Expo + Convex)
items.description: A cross-platform todo app with real-time sync, theme switching, and drag-and-drop.
bullets: Convex live queries keep tasks synced across devices without manual polling.
Reanimated + gesture-handler deliver drag-and-drop reordering with subtle haptics.
Offline queue retries pending writes so no todos vanish if the network drops.

items.title: Framez Social App (Expo + Supabase)
items.description: A social posting app with authenticated feed, media uploads, likes, and notifications.
bullets: Supabase auth + row level security lock down user data while still enabling public discovery.
Expo Router screens stream next feed batch before users scroll for perceived instant loading.
Push notification preferences let users pick digests, mentions only, or mute entirely.

cards.title: How I approach frontend development
cards.description: Every project starts with clarity. I define the outcome, map a single primary user path, then design the UI and architecture around that path.
bullets: Design-led architecture. Components and routes follow a clear inventory rather than improvisation.
Performance from the start. Minimal dependencies, simple layouts, fast first paint.
Accessibility baked in. Semantics, focus, labels, and error messaging are part of the initial build.

cards.title: Stacks I am confident with
cards.description: On the web, I work comfortably with React, Next.js, Vue, Twig templates, and modern vanilla JavaScript. On mobile, I work with React Native and Expo, backed by Convex or Supabase for real-time data.
